result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane J Cataldo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete high school education.  Obtain and maintain employment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Absolute sobriety is required.
Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  No driving unless properly licensed.  Must reside with mother until such time as mother and agent approve of alternate residence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Def does not plan to seek postconviction relief.
granted probation; no additional jail time

Defendant Shane J Cataldo in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Shane J Cataldo in custody.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin as a special prosecutor.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
PSI received and reviewed.  
State's recommendation is for 3 yrs confinement and 3 yrs extended supervision to be imposed and stayed with 3 yrs probation on the felony BJ.  Will also recommend some jail time.  On the misdemeanor charges, probation is also recommended.
State's sentencing argument.  State is not in agreement with defendant's expungment request, but will defer to the Court.
Defense sentencing argument.
Statement by defendant's mother
Statement by defendant

Defendant Shane J Cataldo in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Shane J Cataldo in custody.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared by speaker phone for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Shane J Cataldo in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Defendant Shane J Cataldo in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.]
PH to be set in front of Judge with other files.
BTC:  Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Shane J Cataldo in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Shane J Cataldo in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeares on behalf of special prosecution for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
